alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit; Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 06 at 10:00AM HST until March 10 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE SUMMITS OF THE BIG ISLAND AND HALEAKALA... .A broad upper level trough will move over the state and will bring a prolonged period of very strong winds for the summits of the Big Island and the summit of Haleakala this week. Winds could stay very strong through the weekend. ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 45 to 75 mph with localized gusts over 100 mph possible. * WHERE...Summits of the Big Island and Haleakala. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through at least Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong could make driving and walking dangerous. The winds could forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch for the summits means that strong and potentially damaging winds in excess of 56 mph with frequent gusts over 66 mph are expected but not yet occurring. Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
